info.description: TOQ Server - Real Estate HTTP API Server with hexagonal architecture.
info.title: TOQ Server API

get.description: Returns holiday calendars with filtering and pagination options.

put.description: Updates an existing holiday calendar metadata.

post.description: Creates a new holiday calendar available for scheduling operations.
Returns the metadata of a specific holiday calendar.

get.description: Returns holiday dates for a calendar with optional range filters.

put.description: Updates an existing holiday date within a calendar.

post.description: Registers a new holiday date within a calendar.

delete.description: Removes a holiday date from a calendar.

post.description: Retrieves details about a specific holiday date entry.

get.description: Available categories: property_owner, property_delivered, who_lives, transaction_type, installment_plan, financing_blocker, visit_type, accompanying_type, guarantee_type.

Retrieve a paginated list of all HTTP routes registered in the system.
Supports filtering by HTTP method (GET, POST, etc.) and path pattern (substring match).
The `action` field in the response follows the format `METHOD:PATH`, which is used for permission management.
Useful for API discovery, debugging, and populating frontend permission forms.
Requires admin-level permissions.

parameters.description: Filter by birth date from (RFC3339 or YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: bornAtFrom

parameters.description: Filter by birth date to (RFC3339 or YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: bornAtTo

parameters.description: Filter by last activity from (RFC3339 or YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: lastActivityFrom

parameters.description: Filter by last activity to (RFC3339 or YYYY-MM-DD)
parameters.name: lastActivityTo

post.description: Status must be one of the allowed enum values. On success, sends FCM notification.
post.summary: Approve or refuse realtor status manually

post.description: Returns signed URLs (selfie/front/back) for a realtor user, valid for a limited time
post.summary: Get signed download URLs for CRECI documents

get.description: Returns id, nickname, fullName, nationalID, creciNumber, creciValidity, creciState

post.description: Create a System User with roleSlug: (photographer, attendantRealtor, attendantOwner, attendant, manager) and details. Not for Owner/Realtor user creation. Email with instruction will be sent to the new user.
Create a new agency account with user information

parameters.description: Device ID (UUIDv4). Optional but recommended when providing deviceToken for automatic sign-in
parameters.name: X-Device-Id

parameters.description: Agency creation data (include optional deviceToken for push notifications)
parameters.name: request

post.description: Create a new owner account with user information. Address fields come from CEP lookup, except number, neighborhood and complement which honor the request payload.

parameters.description: Device ID (UUIDv4). Optional but recommended when providing deviceToken for automatic sign-in
parameters.name: X-Device-Id

parameters.description: Owner creation data (include optional deviceToken for push notifications)
parameters.name: request

post.description: Confirm password change using verification code

422.description: Invalid verification code or password validation failed

post.description: Initiate password change process by sending verification code

Create a new realtor account with user and CRECI information. Address fields come from CEP lookup, except number, neighborhood and complement which honor the request payload. CRECI number must be numeric ending with "-F" and CRECI state must be a valid Brazilian UF (both required).

parameters.description: Device ID (UUIDv4). Optional but recommended when providing deviceToken for automatic sign-in
parameters.name: X-Device-Id

parameters.description: Realtor creation data (include optional deviceToken for push notifications)
parameters.name: request

post.description: Generate new access token using refresh token
Authenticate user with national ID and password. Requires deviceToken body field and X-Device-Id (UUIDv4) header for per-device associations.

parameters.description: Device ID (UUIDv4). Required for associating sessions to devices.
parameters.name: X-Device-Id

400.description: Invalid request format or missing/invalid deviceToken or X-Device-Id header

423.description: Account temporarily locked due to security measures

post.description: Retrieves CEP information using the configured provider. Requires signed payload.
Validates a CNPJ using Receita Federal integration. Requires signed payload.
Validates a CPF using Receita Federal integration. Requires signed payload.

get.description: Supports pagination, wildcard search for strings using '*', and range filters for numbers and dates.

parameters.description: Filter by zip code (digits only; supports '*' wildcard)
parameters.name: zipCode

put.description: Allows partial updates for draft listings. Omitted fields remain unchanged; present fields (including null/empty) overwrite stored values. **IMPORTANT TAX RULES**: (1) IPTU (property tax) requires exactly ONE field: either `annualTax` OR `monthlyTax`, never both simultaneously. (2) Laudmio (ground rent) is optional but if provided, use either `annualGroundRent` OR `monthlyGroundRent`, never both.

parameters.x-example: {"listingIdentityId":1024,"listingVersionId":5001,"owner":"myself","features":[{"featureId":101,"quantity":2},{"featureId":205,"quantity":1}],"landSize":423.5,"corner":true,"nonBuildable":12.75,"buildable":410.75,"delivered":"furnished","whoLives":"tenant","description":"Apartamento amplo com vista panoramica","transaction":"sale","sellNet":1200000,"rentNet":8500,"condominium":1200.5,"monthlyTax":283.40,"monthlyGroundRent":150,"exchange":true,"exchangePercentual":50,"exchangePlaces":[{"neighborhood":"Vila Mariana","city":"Sao Paulo","state":"SP"},{"neighborhood":"Centro","city":"Campinas","state":"SP"}],"installment":"short_term","financing":true,"financingBlockers":["pending_probate","other"],"guarantees":[{"priority":1,"guarantee":"security_deposit"},{"priority":2,"guarantee":"surety_bond"}],"visit":"client","tenantName":"Joao da Silva","tenantEmail":"joao.silva@example.com","tenantPhone":"+5511912345678","title":"Apartamento 3 dormitorios com piscina","accompanying":"assistant","completionForecast":"2026-06","landBlock":"A","landLot":"15","landFront":12.5,"landSide":30.0,"landBack":12.5,"landTerrainType":"plano","hasKmz":true,"kmzFile":"https://storage.exemplo.com/terrenos/lote15.kmz","buildingFloors":8,"unitTower":"Torre B","unitFloor":5,"unitNumber":"502","warehouseManufacturingArea":850.5,"warehouseSector":"industrial","warehouseHasPrimaryCabin":true,"warehouseCabinKva":150.0,"warehouseGroundFloor":4.2,"warehouseFloorResistance":2500.0,"warehouseZoning":"ZI-2","warehouseHasOfficeArea":true,"warehouseOfficeArea":120.0,"warehouseAdditionalFloors":[{"floorName":"Mezanino","floorOrder":1,"floorHeight":3.5},{"floorName":"Segundo Piso","floorOrder":2,"floorHeight":3.2}],"storeHasMezzanine":true,"storeMezzanineArea":45.0}
parameters.description: Payload for update (listingIdentityId and listingVersionId are required)
parameters.name: request

422.description: Tax field conflict: both annual and monthly values provided for IPTU or Laudmio

post.description: Create a new listing with address details validated against the zip code information

get.description: Available categories: property_owner, property_delivered, who_lives, transaction_type, installment_plan, financing_blocker, visit_type, accompanying_type, guarantee_type.
Returns all fields of a listing given its identifier, including active photo session ID if exists.
Get all available base features that can be associated with listings

post.description: Finds the most recent READY batch for a listing and generates time-limited signed S3 URLs for downloading processed assets (optimized images/videos). Includes preview URLs for thumbnails. Returns 204 if no READY batch exists.
post.summary: Get signed download URLs for processed media

post.description: Returns batch status (PENDING_UPLOAD/RECEIVED/PROCESSING/READY/FAILED) along with asset details (titles, sequences, object keys). Used by frontend to poll progress and determine when downloads are available.

Validates permissions (photographer booking or owner for project media), enforces listing status PENDING_PHOTO_PROCESSING, creates a media batch and returns signed PUT URLs with required headers (Content-Type, checksum). Rejects duplicates (sequence/title) and unsupported media types.
post.summary: Request upload URLs for a listing media batch

403.description: Forbidden - User not allowed to upload for this listing

404.description: Listing not found or not in PENDING_PHOTO_PROCESSING

post.description: Validates S3 uploads via HEAD requests checking checksums, consolidates asset titles/sequences, updates batch status to RECEIVED, registers processing job and enqueues it to SQS. Returns job ID and estimated processing duration.
post.summary: Confirm upload completion and start processing

parameters.description: Upload confirmation with object keys and checksums
parameters.name: request

404.description: Batch not found or not in PENDING_UPLOAD

post.description: Accepts batches in FAILED or READY status and creates a new processing job reusing existing raw S3 objects. Updates batch status to PROCESSING and enqueues the job to SQS with retry flag. Always returns 202 with new job ID.

400.description: Invalid request or batch not in terminal status

post.description: Get available property types for listings based on location
Retrieves all versions attached to a listing identity, indicating which one is currently active.
post.summary: List listing versions by identity ID

parameters.description: Listing identity ID and filter options
parameters.name: request

200.description: List of versions with active flag

400.description: Invalid request body or validation error

post.description: Deletes a draft listing version and its satellite entities, keeping the active version untouched.
Create a new draft version from the current active listing version

409.description: Draft already exists or listing is published

post.description: Promotes a draft listing version to become the active version for its identity, preserving historical records.

get.description: Retrieves the photographer's agenda, including available and blocked slots, within a given date range. Optional entryType filter to retrieve only specific types of entries. Photo session entries include the photoSessionId field for approval workflows.
Lists time-off periods for the authenticated photographer within a date range.

put.description: Updates an existing time-off period for the authenticated photographer and refreshes agenda slots.

post.description: Registers a new time-off period for the authenticated photographer, blocking their agenda.

delete.description: Removes an existing time-off period for the authenticated photographer, making slots available again.

post.description: Retrieves a specific time-off entry for the authenticated photographer.

get.description: Lists the service areas configured by the authenticated photographer.

put.description: Updates the city and state of an existing service area.

post.description: Creates a new service area for the authenticated photographer.

delete.description: Deletes a service area owned by the authenticated photographer.

post.description: Retrieves a service area owned by the authenticated photographer.
Updates a photo session booking status with support for approval/rejection and completion workflows.

400.description: Invalid payload or approval disabled for ACCEPTED/REJECTED transitions

403.description: Forbidden - session does not belong to photographer

409.description: Session not in valid state for requested transition

422.description: Invalid status value (must be ACCEPTED, REJECTED, or DONE)

post.description: Create a pre-signed URL to upload a CRECI document (selfie/front/back)
post.summary: Create pre-signed upload URL for CRECI documents

post.description: Check if selfie.jpg, front.jpg and back.jpg exist in the user's S3 folder; if all exist, set status to PendingManual

get.description: Returns all agenda entries for a specific listing owned by the authenticated user.
get.summary: List agenda entries for a listing

get.description: Returns the available slots for a listing within the provided time range.
Returns the recurring blocking rules configured for a listing owned by the authenticated user.
get.summary: List recurring block rules for a listing agenda

put.description: Updates an existing recurring blocking rule for a listing agenda.

post.description: Creates recurring blocking rules for a listing agenda.

delete.description: Removes a recurring blocking rule from a listing agenda.

post.description: Marks the listing agenda as finished and moves listing to pending photo scheduling.

get.description: Returns a consolidated view of agenda entries for all listings owned by the authenticated user.

delete.description: Logically delete the current user's account. Revokes all sessions and removes device tokens. User data and role history are preserved for audit purposes and regulatory compliance (LGPD). The account cannot be restored after deletion, but the user may create a new account with the same credentials (email, phone, CPF).

post.description: Confirm email change by providing the received validation code

409.description: Email change not pending or already in use

post.description: Start email change by generating a validation code for the new email. If a pending change exists (valid or expired), a new code and expiration are generated and persisted, then a notification is sent.
Resend the existing (still valid) validation code to the pending new email address. If there is no pending change, returns 409. If the code is expired, returns 410.

409.description: Email change not pending or email already in use

put.description: Update user's consent to receive notifications (opt-in/opt-out)

post.description: Confirm a phone number change using the verification code sent to the new phone

409.description: Phone change not pending or phone already in use

post.description: Start a phone change by generating a validation code for the new phone. If a pending change exists (valid or expired), a new code and expiration are generated and persisted, then a notification is sent.
Resend the existing (still valid) validation code to the pending new phone number. If there is no pending change, returns 409. If the code is expired, returns 410.

409.description: Phone change not pending or phone already in use

post.description: Create a pre-signed URL to download a specific profile photo variant from storage
post.summary: Create pre-signed download URL for profile photo

post.description: Create a pre-signed URL to upload a profile photo to storage
post.summary: Create pre-signed upload URL for profile photo

422.description: Validation error (photo type or content type)

get.description: Get the current authenticated user's profile information

put.description: Update profile fields like nickname, born_at, and address. Email/phone/password have dedicated flows.

post.description: Allows owners to request a realtor role (pending CRECI validation) and vice versa. CRECI fields are optional, but when provided: creciNumber must end with "-F", and creciState must be a valid Brazilian state abbreviation (2 letters).
post.summary: Create an alternative role for the authenticated user (owner  realtor)

post.description: Allows users who have both owner and realtor roles to switch between them.
post.summary: Switch the authenticated user's active role (owner  realtor)

post.description: Sign out the current user. If refreshToken or deviceToken is provided, revokes a single session/device and removes associated push tokens. Provide X-Device-Id when targeting a specific device.

parameters.description: Device ID (UUIDv4). Recommended for targeted signout so device tokens are purged
parameters.name: X-Device-Id

get.description: Returns the status of the currently active user role. Absence of an active role is treated as internal inconsistency.

200.description: Active role status (status campo inteiro enum ver comentrios DTO)

routes.description: List of routes for the current page

clientId.description: ClientID matches the original clientId for correlation

processedKey.description:
ProcessedKey is the S3 key where the processed file is stored
Empty until processing completes successfully

rawObjectKey.description:
RawObjectKey is the S3 key where the raw file is stored
Empty until upload is confirmed

thumbnailKey.description:
ThumbnailKey is the S3 key where the thumbnail is stored
Empty until processing completes successfully

batchId.description: BatchID must match the batchId from CreateUploadBatch

files.description:
Files lists all successfully uploaded assets with S3 metadata
Must include all files from the original manifest

listingId.description: ListingID must match the listingId from CreateUploadBatch

estimatedDurationSeconds.description:
EstimatedDurationSeconds provides a rough estimate of processing time
Actual duration depends on file count, sizes, and pipeline load

jobId.description:
JobID is the unique identifier for the async processing job
Used for monitoring and troubleshooting

status.description: Status indicates the current batch status (typically RECEIVED)

bytes.description: Bytes is the confirmed file size after upload (should match original)

checksum.description: Checksum is the SHA-256 hash used for upload verification

clientId.description: ClientID must match a clientId from the original CreateUploadBatch request

etag.description:
ETag is the S3 ETag returned after successful upload
Optional but recommended for additional verification

objectKey.description: ObjectKey must match the objectKey returned in CreateUploadBatch

assetType.description:
AssetType categorizes the media for processing and display
Allowed values: PHOTO_VERTICAL, PHOTO_HORIZONTAL, VIDEO_VERTICAL, VIDEO_HORIZONTAL,
                THUMBNAIL, ZIP, PROJECT_DOC, PROJECT_RENDER
Example: "PHOTO_VERTICAL"

bytes.description:
Bytes is the file size in bytes
Must be positive and not exceed the maximum file size limit
Example: 2457600 (2.4 MB)

checksum.description:
Checksum is the SHA-256 hash of the file content (hex-encoded)
Used to verify upload integrity via S3 HeadObject
Example: "e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855"

clientId.description:
ClientID is a unique identifier assigned by the client (frontend)
Used to correlate upload confirmation and error messages
Must be unique within the batch
Example: "photo-001"

contentType.description:
ContentType is the MIME type of the file
Must be in the allowed content types list (configured in env.yaml)
Common values: image/jpeg, image/png, image/heic, video/mp4, video/quicktime
Example: "image/jpeg"

filename.description:
Filename is the original filename from the client device
Used for download metadata and logging
Example: "IMG_20231116_140530.jpg"

metadata.description:
Metadata holds additional key-value pairs for processing hints
Optional field for future extensibility

orientation.description:
Orientation specifies the intended display orientation
Required for photo and video types
Allowed values: VERTICAL, HORIZONTAL
Example: "VERTICAL"

sequence.description:
Sequence determines the display order in the listing carousel
Must be positive and unique within the batch
Example: 1

title.description:
Title is an optional user-provided caption or description
Displayed in the listing carousel
Example: "Vista frontal do imvel"

batchReference.description:
BatchReference helps the frontend correlate retries
Typically a timestamp or session identifier
Maximum 120 characters
Example: "2025-11-16T14:00Z-slot-123"

files.description:
Files enumerates every asset to upload, preserving carousel order and metadata
Minimum 1 file, maximum defined by environment configuration (default 60)
Each file must have unique clientId and sequence

listingId.description:
ListingID identifies the listing identity receiving the batch
Must correspond to a listing in PENDING_PHOTO_PROCESSING status
Example: 123

batchId.description:
BatchID is the unique identifier for this upload batch
Required for subsequent CompleteUploadBatch and status polling calls

files.description: Files contains upload instructions for each asset in the manifest

listingId.description: ListingID confirms the listing receiving the uploads

uploadUrlTtlSeconds.description:
UploadURLTTLSeconds indicates how long the signed URLs remain valid
Typically 900 seconds (15 minutes)

clientId.description: ClientID matches the original clientId for correlation

expiresAt.description:
ExpiresAt indicates when the signed URL expires
RFC3339 format timestamp

previewUrl.description:
PreviewURL is the pre-signed S3 URL for downloading a thumbnail/preview
Empty if no thumbnail was generated

url.description:
URL is the pre-signed S3 URL for downloading the processed file
Valid for the duration specified in TTLSeconds

batchId.description: BatchID identifies the specific batch to query

listingId.description: ListingID identifies the listing owning the batch

assets.description: Assets lists all assets in the batch with their processing status

status.description:
Status indicates the current batch status
Possible values: PENDING_UPLOAD, RECEIVED, PROCESSING, READY, FAILED

statusMessage.description:
StatusMessage provides human-readable status information
Includes error details for FAILED status

batchId.description:
BatchID identifies the specific batch to retrieve downloads for
If zero, the most recent READY batch will be used

listingId.description: ListingID identifies the listing owning the assets

downloads.description: Downloads contains signed URLs for each processed asset

generatedAt.description:
GeneratedAt indicates when the signed URLs were created
RFC3339 format timestamp

ttlSeconds.description:
TTLSeconds indicates how long the signed URLs remain valid
Typically 3600 seconds (1 hour)

includeDeleted.description:
IncludeDeleted determines whether soft-deleted versions should be included in results
When true, returns both active and soft-deleted versions
When false (default), returns only active versions (deleted = 0)
Example: false

listingIdentityId.description:
ListingIdentityID is the unique identifier of the listing identity
Required field to identify which listing's versions should be retrieved
Must be greater than 0
Example: 1024
ListingIdentityID is the identity whose versions are being returned

listingUuid.description: ListingUUID is the immutable UUID for this listing identity

versions.description:
Versions contains the list of all versions for this listing
Array is ordered by version number descending

id.description: ID is the unique identifier for this specific version

isActive.description:
IsActive indicates if this version is currently the active one
Only one version per listing identity should have IsActive = true

listingIdentityId.description: ListingIdentityID is the parent listing identity this version belongs to

listingUuid.description: ListingUUID is the immutable UUID for the listing identity

status.description:
Status indicates the current lifecycle state of this version
Possible values: "DRAFT", "ACTIVE", "INACTIVE", "DELETED"

title.description: Title is the listing title for this version (may be empty for drafts)

version.description: Version is the sequential version number (1, 2, 3, ...)

batchId.description: BatchID identifies the specific batch to retry

listingId.description: ListingID identifies the listing owning the batch

reason.description:
Reason explains why the batch is being retried
Used for audit logging and troubleshooting
Example: "Pipeline timeout - retrying with increased timeout"
reason.example: Pipeline timeout - retrying with increased timeout

jobId.description: JobID is the unique identifier for the new async processing job

status.description: Status indicates the current batch status (typically PROCESSING)

method.description: HTTP method (GET, POST, PUT, DELETE, PATCH, etc.)

path.description: Route path with Gin parameter syntax

github_com_projeto-toq_toq_server_intern.description: Response after creating a new listing. Use listingIdentityId and listingVersionId for subsequent PUT /listing updates.

clientId.description: ClientID matches the clientId from the request for correlation

headers.description:
Headers contains required HTTP headers for the upload request
Typically includes Content-Type and x-amz-checksum-sha256

method.description: Method is the HTTP method to use for the upload (always PUT)

sequence.description: Sequence matches the sequence from the request

title.description: Title matches the title from the request

uploadUrl.description:
UploadURL is the pre-signed S3 URL for uploading the file
Valid for the duration specified in UploadURLTTLSeconds
Example: "https://s3.amazonaws.com/bucket/key?X-Amz-Algorithm=..."

github_com_projeto-toq_toq_server_intern.description: Assinatura da requisio deve ser calculada com METHOD|PATH|timestamp|payload_compacto_sem_campo_hmac
Additional floor information for warehouses (mezanino, second floor, etc.)

BearerAuth.description: Type "Bearer" followed by a space and JWT token.
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
